data TagDescription

-- | <a>TagDescription</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>tdKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tdPropagateAtLaunch</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>tdResourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tdResourceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tdValue</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
tagDescription :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Bool -> TagDescription

-- | The tag key.
tdKey :: Lens' TagDescription Text

-- | Specifies whether the tag is applied to instances launched after the
--   tag is created. The same behavior applies to updates: If you change a
--   tag, it is applied to all instances launched after you made the
--   change.
tdPropagateAtLaunch :: Lens' TagDescription Bool

-- | The name of the group.
tdResourceId :: Lens' TagDescription Text

-- | The kind of resource to which the tag is applied. Currently, Auto
--   Scaling supports the 'auto-scaling-group' resource type.
tdResourceType :: Lens' TagDescription Text

-- | The tag value.
tdValue :: Lens' TagDescription Text
data Tag

-- | <a>Tag</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>tagKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tagPropagateAtLaunch</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>tagResourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tagResourceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tagValue</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
tag :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Bool -> Tag

-- | The tag key.
tagKey :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Specifies whether the tag is applied to instances launched after the
--   tag is created. The same behavior applies to updates: If you change a
--   tag, it is applied to all instances launched after you made the
--   change.
tagPropagateAtLaunch :: Lens' Tag Bool

-- | The name of the group.
tagResourceId :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The kind of resource to which the tag is applied. Currently, Auto
--   Scaling supports the 'auto-scaling-group' resource type.
tagResourceType :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The tag value.
tagValue :: Lens' Tag Text
data NotificationConfiguration

-- | <a>NotificationConfiguration</a> constructor.

--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:

--   </ul>
notificationConfiguration :: NotificationConfiguration

-- | The name of the group.
ncAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' NotificationConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The types of events for an action to start.
ncNotificationType :: Lens' NotificationConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Simple Notification
--   Service (SNS) topic.
ncTopicARN :: Lens' NotificationConfiguration (Maybe Text)
data BlockDeviceMapping

-- | <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>bdmDeviceName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>bdmEbs</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Ebs</a></li>
--   <li><a>bdmNoDevice</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>bdmVirtualName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
blockDeviceMapping :: Text -> BlockDeviceMapping

-- | The device name exposed to the EC2 instance (for example, '/dev/sdh'
--   or <tt>xvdh</tt>).
bdmDeviceName :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping Text

-- | The information about the Amazon EBS volume.
bdmEbs :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Ebs)

-- | Suppresses a device mapping.
--   
--   If <tt>NoDevice</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt> for the root device, the
--   instance might fail the EC2 health check. Auto Scaling launches a
--   replacement instance if the instance fails the health check.
bdmNoDevice :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the virtual device, <tt>ephemeral0</tt> to
--   <tt>ephemeral3</tt>.
bdmVirtualName :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)
data LaunchConfiguration

-- | <a>LaunchConfiguration</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lcAssociatePublicIpAddress</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>

--   <li><a>lcSpotPrice</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lcUserData</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
launchConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> LaunchConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether the EC2 instances are associated with a public IP
--   address (<tt>true</tt>) or not (<tt>false</tt>).
lcAssociatePublicIpAddress :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | A block device mapping that specifies how block devices are exposed to
--   the instance. Each mapping is made up of a <tt>virtualName</tt> and a
--   <tt>deviceName</tt>.
lcBlockDeviceMappings :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration [BlockDeviceMapping]

-- | The ID of a ClassicLink-enabled VPC to link your EC2-Classic instances
--   to. This parameter can only be used if you are launching EC2-Classic
--   instances. For more information, see <a>ClassicLink</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Elastic Compute CloudUser Guide</i>.
lcClassicLinkVPCId :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The IDs of one or more security groups for the VPC specified in
--   <tt>ClassicLinkVPCId</tt>. This parameter is required if
--   <tt>ClassicLinkVPCId</tt> is specified, and cannot be used otherwise.
--   For more information, see <a>ClassicLink</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   ElasticCompute Cloud User Guide</i>.
lcClassicLinkVPCSecurityGroups :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration [Text]

-- | The creation date and time for the launch configuration.
lcCreatedTime :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration UTCTime

-- | Controls whether the instance is optimized for EBS I/O (<tt>true</tt>)
--   or not (<tt>false</tt>).
lcEbsOptimized :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile
--   associated with the IAM role for the instance.
lcIamInstanceProfile :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI).
lcImageId :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration Text

-- | Controls whether instances in this group are launched with detailed
--   monitoring.
lcInstanceMonitoring :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe InstanceMonitoring)

-- | The instance type for the EC2 instances.
lcInstanceType :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration Text

-- | The ID of the kernel associated with the AMI.
lcKernelId :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the key pair.
lcKeyName :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the launch configuration.
lcLaunchConfigurationARN :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the launch configuration.
lcLaunchConfigurationName :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration Text

-- | The tenancy of the instance, either 'default' or <tt>dedicated</tt>.
--   An instance with <tt>dedicated</tt> tenancy runs in an isolated,
--   single-tenant hardware and can only be launched in a VPC.
lcPlacementTenancy :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the RAM disk associated with the AMI.
lcRamdiskId :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The security groups to associate with the EC2 instances.
lcSecurityGroups :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration [Text]

-- | The price to bid when launching Spot Instances.
lcSpotPrice :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The user data available to the EC2 instances.
lcUserData :: Lens' LaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)
data AutoScalingGroup

-- | <a>AutoScalingGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:

--   <li><a>asgMinSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>

--   <li><a>asgStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>asgSuspendedProcesses</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>SuspendedProcess</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>asgTags</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>TagDescription</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>asgTerminationPolicies</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>asgVPCZoneIdentifier</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
autoScalingGroup :: Text -> Text -> Int -> Int -> Int -> Int -> NonEmpty Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> AutoScalingGroup

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group.
asgAutoScalingGroupARN :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the group.
asgAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup Text

-- | One or more Availability Zones for the group.
asgAvailabilityZones :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The date and time the group was created.
asgCreatedTime :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup UTCTime

-- | The number of seconds after a scaling activity completes before any
--   further scaling activities can start.
asgDefaultCooldown :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup Int

-- | The size of the group.
asgDesiredCapacity :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup Int

-- | The metrics enabled for this Auto Scaling group.
asgEnabledMetrics :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup [EnabledMetric]

-- | The amount of time that Auto Scaling waits before checking an
--   instance's health status. The grace period begins when an instance
--   comes into service.
asgHealthCheckGracePeriod :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The service of interest for the health status check, which can be
--   either <tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon EC2 or <tt>ELB</tt> for Elastic Load
--   Balancing.
asgHealthCheckType :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup Text

-- | The EC2 instances associated with the group.
asgInstances :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup [Instance]

-- | The name of the associated launch configuration.
asgLaunchConfigurationName :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup Text

-- | One or more load balancers associated with the group.
asgLoadBalancerNames :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup [Text]

-- | The maximum size of the group.
asgMaxSize :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup Int

-- | The minimum size of the group.
asgMinSize :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup Int

-- | The name of the placement group into which you'll launch your
--   instances, if any. For more information, see <a>Placement Groups</a>.
asgPlacementGroup :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the Auto Scaling group when a
--   <tt>DeleteAutoScalingGroup</tt> action is in progress.
asgStatus :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The suspended processes associated with the group.
asgSuspendedProcesses :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup [SuspendedProcess]

-- | The tags for the Auto Scaling group.
asgTags :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup [TagDescription]

-- | The termination policies for this Auto Scaling group.
asgTerminationPolicies :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup [Text]

-- | One or more subnet IDs, if applicable, separated by commas.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>VPCZoneIdentifier</tt> and
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt>, ensure that the Availability Zones of the
--   subnets match the values for <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt>.
asgVPCZoneIdentifier :: Lens' AutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)
data ScalingPolicy

-- | <a>ScalingPolicy</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sp1AdjustmentType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sp1Alarms</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Alarm</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>sp1AutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sp1Cooldown</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sp1MinAdjustmentStep</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sp1PolicyARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sp1PolicyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sp1ScalingAdjustment</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
scalingPolicy :: ScalingPolicy

-- | Specifies whether the <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is an absolute number
--   or a percentage of the current capacity. Valid values are
--   <tt>ChangeInCapacity</tt>, <tt>ExactCapacity</tt>, and
--   <tt>PercentChangeInCapacity</tt>.
sp1AdjustmentType :: Lens' ScalingPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The CloudWatch Alarms related to the policy.
sp1Alarms :: Lens' ScalingPolicy [Alarm]

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group associated with this scaling
--   policy.
sp1AutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' ScalingPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes
--   before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start.
sp1Cooldown :: Lens' ScalingPolicy (Maybe Int)

-- | Changes the <tt>DesiredCapacity</tt> of the Auto Scaling group by at
--   least the specified number of instances.
sp1MinAdjustmentStep :: Lens' ScalingPolicy (Maybe Int)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
sp1PolicyARN :: Lens' ScalingPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the scaling policy.
sp1PolicyName :: Lens' ScalingPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The number associated with the specified adjustment type. A positive
--   value adds to the current capacity and a negative value removes from
--   the current capacity.
sp1ScalingAdjustment :: Lens' ScalingPolicy (Maybe Int)
data InstanceMonitoring

-- | <a>InstanceMonitoring</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>

--   </ul>
instanceMonitoring :: InstanceMonitoring

-- | If <a>True</a>, instance monitoring is enabled.
imEnabled :: Lens' InstanceMonitoring (Maybe Bool)
data ScheduledUpdateGroupAction

-- | <a>ScheduledUpdateGroupAction</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sugaAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>

--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sugaEndTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>sugaMaxSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sugaMinSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sugaRecurrence</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sugaScheduledActionARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>

--   <a>Text</a></li>

--   <li><a>sugaTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   </ul>
scheduledUpdateGroupAction :: ScheduledUpdateGroupAction

-- | The name of the group.
sugaAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of instances you prefer to maintain in the group.
sugaDesiredCapacity :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Int)

-- | The time that the action is scheduled to end. This value can be up to
--   one month in the future.
sugaEndTime :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The maximum size of the group.
sugaMaxSize :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Int)

-- | The minimum size of the group.
sugaMinSize :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Int)

-- | The regular schedule that an action occurs.
sugaRecurrence :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the scheduled action.
sugaScheduledActionARN :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the scheduled action.
sugaScheduledActionName :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the action is scheduled to begin. This value can be up
--   to one month in the future.
--   
--   When <tt>StartTime</tt> and <tt>EndTime</tt> are specified with
--   <tt>Recurrence</tt>, they form the boundaries of when the recurring
--   action will start and stop.
sugaStartTime :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | <a>Time</a> is deprecated.
--   
--   The time that the action is scheduled to begin. <a>Time</a> is an
--   alias for <tt>StartTime</tt>.
sugaTime :: Lens' ScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe UTCTime)
data ScalingProcessQuery

-- | <a>ScalingProcessQuery</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>spqAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>spqScalingProcesses</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
scalingProcessQuery :: Text -> ScalingProcessQuery

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Auto Scaling group.
spqAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' ScalingProcessQuery Text

-- | One or more of the following processes:
--   
--   Launch Terminate HealthCheck ReplaceUnhealthy AZRebalance
--   AlarmNotification ScheduledActions AddToLoadBalancer
spqScalingProcesses :: Lens' ScalingProcessQuery [Text]
data Ebs

-- | <a>Ebs</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ebsDeleteOnTermination</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>ebsIops</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ebsSnapshotId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ebsVolumeSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ebsVolumeType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
ebs :: Ebs

-- | Indicates whether to delete the volume on instance termination.
--   
--   Default: <tt>true</tt>
ebsDeleteOnTermination :: Lens' Ebs (Maybe Bool)

-- | For Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes only. The number of I/O operations
--   per second (IOPS) to provision for the volume.
--   
--   Valid values: Range is 100 to 4000.
--   
--   Default: None
ebsIops :: Lens' Ebs (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ID of the snapshot.
ebsSnapshotId :: Lens' Ebs (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume size, in gigabytes.
--   
--   Valid values: If the volume type is <tt>io1</tt>, the minimum size of
--   the volume is 10 GiB. If you specify <tt>SnapshotId</tt> and
--   <tt>VolumeSize</tt>, <tt>VolumeSize</tt> must be equal to or larger
--   than the size of the snapshot.
--   
--   Default: If you create a volume from a snapshot and you don't specify
--   a volume size, the default is the size of the snapshot.
--   
--   Required: Required when the volume type is <tt>io1</tt>.
ebsVolumeSize :: Lens' Ebs (Maybe Natural)

-- | The volume type.
--   
--   Valid values: 'standard | io1 | gp2'
--   
--   Default: <tt>standard</tt>
ebsVolumeType :: Lens' Ebs (Maybe Text)
data AdjustmentType

-- | <a>AdjustmentType</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>atAdjustmentType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
adjustmentType :: AdjustmentType

-- | The policy adjustment type. The valid values are
--   <tt>ChangeInCapacity</tt>, <tt>ExactCapacity</tt>, and
--   <tt>PercentChangeInCapacity</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Dynamic Scaling</a> in the <i>Auto
--   Scaling Developer Guide</i> .
atAdjustmentType :: Lens' AdjustmentType (Maybe Text)
data MetricCollectionType

-- | <a>MetricCollectionType</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mctMetric</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
metricCollectionType :: MetricCollectionType

-- | The metric.
mctMetric :: Lens' MetricCollectionType (Maybe Text)
data LifecycleHook

-- | <a>LifecycleHook</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lhAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lhDefaultResult</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lhGlobalTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>lhHeartbeatTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>lhLifecycleHookName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lhLifecycleTransition</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lhNotificationMetadata</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lhNotificationTargetARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lhRoleARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
lifecycleHook :: LifecycleHook

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group for the lifecycle hook.
lhAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | Defines the action the Auto Scaling group should take when the
--   lifecycle hook timeout elapses or if an unexpected failure occurs. The
--   valid values are <tt>CONTINUE</tt> and <tt>ABANDON</tt>. The default
--   value is <tt>CONTINUE</tt>.
lhDefaultResult :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum length of time an instance can remain in a 'Pending:Wait'
--   or 'Terminating:Wait' state. Currently, this value is set at 48 hours.
lhGlobalTimeout :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time that can elapse before the lifecycle hook times
--   out. When the lifecycle hook times out, Auto Scaling performs the
--   action defined in the <tt>DefaultResult</tt> parameter. You can
--   prevent the lifecycle hook from timing out by calling
--   <tt>RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat</tt>.
lhHeartbeatTimeout :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the lifecycle hook.
lhLifecycleHookName :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the EC2 instance to which you want to attach the
--   lifecycle hook. For a list of lifecycle hook types, see
--   <tt>DescribeLifecycleHooks</tt>.
lhLifecycleTransition :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional information that you want to include any time Auto Scaling
--   sends a message to the notification target.
lhNotificationMetadata :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the notification target that Auto Scaling uses to notify
--   you when an instance is in the transition state for the lifecycle
--   hook. This ARN target can be either an SQS queue or an SNS topic. The
--   notification message sent to the target includes the following:
--   
--   Lifecycle action token User account ID Name of the Auto Scaling group
--   Lifecycle hook name EC2 instance ID Lifecycle transition Notification
--   metadata
lhNotificationTargetARN :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that allows the Auto Scaling group to publish
--   to the specified notification target.
lhRoleARN :: Lens' LifecycleHook (Maybe Text)
data Activity

-- | <a>Activity</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>aActivityId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aCause</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aDetails</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aEndTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>aProgress</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>aStartTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>aStatusCode</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>ScalingActivityStatusCode</a></li>
--   <li><a>aStatusMessage</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
activity :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ScalingActivityStatusCode -> Activity

-- | The ID of the activity.
aActivityId :: Lens' Activity Text

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group.
aAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' Activity Text

-- | The reason the activity was begun.
aCause :: Lens' Activity Text

-- | A friendly, more verbose description of the scaling activity.
aDescription :: Lens' Activity (Maybe Text)

-- | The details about the scaling activity.
aDetails :: Lens' Activity (Maybe Text)

-- | The end time of this activity.
aEndTime :: Lens' Activity (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A value between 0 and 100 that indicates the progress of the activity.
aProgress :: Lens' Activity (Maybe Int)

-- | The start time of this activity.
aStartTime :: Lens' Activity UTCTime

-- | The current status of the activity.
aStatusCode :: Lens' Activity ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | A friendly, more verbose description of the activity status.
aStatusMessage :: Lens' Activity (Maybe Text)
data SuspendedProcess

-- | <a>SuspendedProcess</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>spProcessName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>spSuspensionReason</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
suspendedProcess :: SuspendedProcess

-- | The name of the suspended process.
spProcessName :: Lens' SuspendedProcess (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason that the process was suspended.
spSuspensionReason :: Lens' SuspendedProcess (Maybe Text)
data MetricGranularityType

-- | <a>MetricGranularityType</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>mgtGranularity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
metricGranularityType :: MetricGranularityType

-- | The granularity.
mgtGranularity :: Lens' MetricGranularityType (Maybe Text)
data Filter

-- | <a>Filter</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>fName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>fValues</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
filter' :: Text -> Filter

-- | The name of the filter. The valid values are: '"auto-scaling-group"',
--   '"key"', '"value"', and '"propagate-at-launch"'.
fName :: Lens' Filter Text

-- | The value of the filter.
fValues :: Lens' Filter [Text]
data ProcessType

-- | <a>ProcessType</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ptProcessName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
processType :: Text -> ProcessType

-- | The name of the process.
ptProcessName :: Lens' ProcessType Text
data Alarm

-- | <a>Alarm</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>aAlarmARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aAlarmName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
alarm :: Alarm

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.
aAlarmARN :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the alarm.
aAlarmName :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)
data EnabledMetric

-- | <a>EnabledMetric</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>emGranularity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>emMetric</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
enabledMetric :: EnabledMetric

-- | The granularity of the metric.
emGranularity :: Lens' EnabledMetric (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the metric.
emMetric :: Lens' EnabledMetric (Maybe Text)
data Instance

-- | <a>Instance</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>iAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iHealthStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iLaunchConfigurationName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>iLifecycleState</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>LifecycleState</a></li>
--   </ul>
instance' :: Text -> Text -> LifecycleState -> Text -> Text -> Instance

-- | The Availability Zone associated with this instance.
iAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Instance Text

-- | The health status of the instance.
iHealthStatus :: Lens' Instance Text

-- | The ID of the instance.
iInstanceId :: Lens' Instance Text

-- | The launch configuration associated with the instance.
iLaunchConfigurationName :: Lens' Instance Text

-- | A description of the current lifecycle state.
--   
--   The <a>Quarantined</a> lifecycle state is not used.
iLifecycleState :: Lens' Instance LifecycleState
data LifecycleState

-- | Detached
Detached :: LifecycleState

-- | Detaching
Detaching :: LifecycleState

-- | EnteringStandby
EnteringStandby :: LifecycleState

-- | InService
InService :: LifecycleState

-- | Pending
Pending :: LifecycleState

-- | Pending:Proceed
PendingProceed :: LifecycleState

-- | Pending:Wait
PendingWait :: LifecycleState

-- | Quarantined
Quarantined :: LifecycleState

-- | Standby
Standby :: LifecycleState

-- | Terminated
Terminated :: LifecycleState

-- | Terminating
Terminating :: LifecycleState

-- | Terminating:Proceed
TerminatingProceed :: LifecycleState

-- | Terminating:Wait
TerminatingWait :: LifecycleState
data AutoScalingInstanceDetails

-- | <a>AutoScalingInstanceDetails</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>asidAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>asidAvailabilityZone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>asidHealthStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>asidInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>asidLaunchConfigurationName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>asidLifecycleState</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
autoScalingInstanceDetails :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> AutoScalingInstanceDetails

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group associated with the instance.
asidAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' AutoScalingInstanceDetails Text

-- | The Availability Zone for the instance.
asidAvailabilityZone :: Lens' AutoScalingInstanceDetails Text

-- | The health status of this instance. <a>Healthy</a> means that the
--   instance is healthy and should remain in service. <a>Unhealthy</a>
--   means that the instance is unhealthy and Auto Scaling should terminate
--   and replace it.
asidHealthStatus :: Lens' AutoScalingInstanceDetails Text

-- | The ID of the instance.
asidInstanceId :: Lens' AutoScalingInstanceDetails Text

-- | The launch configuration associated with the instance.
asidLaunchConfigurationName :: Lens' AutoScalingInstanceDetails Text

-- | The lifecycle state for the instance. For more information, see
--   <a>Auto ScalingInstance States</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer
--   Guide</i>.
asidLifecycleState :: Lens' AutoScalingInstanceDetails Text
data ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | Cancelled
Cancelled :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | Failed
Failed :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | InProgress
InProgress :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | MidLifecycleAction
MidLifecycleAction :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | PreInService
PreInService :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | Successful
Successful :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | WaitingForELBConnectionDraining
WaitingForELBConnectionDraining :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | WaitingForInstanceId
WaitingForInstanceId :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | WaitingForSpotInstanceId
WaitingForSpotInstanceId :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

-- | WaitingForSpotInstanceRequestId
WaitingForSpotInstanceRequestId :: ScalingActivityStatusCode

instance AWSService AutoScaling


-- | Updates the configuration for the specified <a>AutoScalingGroup</a>.
--   
--   To update an Auto Scaling group with a launch configuration that has
--   the <a>InstanceMonitoring</a> flag set to <a>False</a>, you must first
--   ensure that collection of group metrics is disabled. Otherwise, calls
--   to <a>UpdateAutoScalingGroup</a> will fail. If you have previously
--   enabled group metrics collection, you can disable collection of all
--   group metrics by calling <tt>DisableMetricsCollection</tt>.
--   
--   The new settings are registered upon the completion of this call. Any
--   launch configuration settings take effect on any triggers after this
--   call returns. Scaling activities that are currently in progress aren't
--   affected.
--   
--   If a new value is specified for <i>MinSize</i> without specifying the
--   value for <i>DesiredCapacity</i>, and if the new <i>MinSize</i> is
--   larger than the current size of the Auto Scaling group, there will be
--   an implicit call to <tt>SetDesiredCapacity</tt> to set the group to
--   the new <i>MinSize</i>.
--   
--   If a new value is specified for <i>MaxSize</i> without specifying the
--   value for <i>DesiredCapacity</i>, and the new <i>MaxSize</i> is
--   smaller than the current size of the Auto Scaling group, there will be
--   an implicit call to <tt>SetDesiredCapacity</tt> to set the group to
--   the new <i>MaxSize</i>.
--   
--   All other optional parameters are left unchanged if not passed in the
--   request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateAutoScalingGroup.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.UpdateAutoScalingGroup
data UpdateAutoScalingGroup

-- | <a>UpdateAutoScalingGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>uasgAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgAvailabilityZones</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>NonEmpty</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgDefaultCooldown</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgDesiredCapacity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgHealthCheckGracePeriod</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgHealthCheckType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgLaunchConfigurationName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgMaxSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgMinSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgPlacementGroup</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uasgTerminationPolicies</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>uasgVPCZoneIdentifier</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateAutoScalingGroup :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> UpdateAutoScalingGroup

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group.
uasgAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup Text

-- | One or more Availability Zones for the group.
uasgAvailabilityZones :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes
--   before another scaling activity can start. For more information, see
--   <a>UnderstandingAuto Scaling Cooldowns</a>.
uasgDefaultCooldown :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of EC2 instances that should be running in the Auto Scaling
--   group. This value must be greater than or equal to the minimum size of
--   the group and less than or equal to the maximum size of the group.
uasgDesiredCapacity :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time, in second, that Auto Scaling waits before checking
--   the health status of an instance. The grace period begins when the
--   instance passes System Status and the Instance Status checks from
--   Amazon EC2. For more information, see <a>DescribeInstanceStatus</a>.
uasgHealthCheckGracePeriod :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The type of health check for the instances in the Auto Scaling group.
--   The health check type can either be <tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon EC2 or
--   <tt>ELB</tt> for Elastic Load Balancing.
uasgHealthCheckType :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the launch configuration.
uasgLaunchConfigurationName :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum size of the Auto Scaling group.
uasgMaxSize :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The minimum size of the Auto Scaling group.
uasgMinSize :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the placement group into which you'll launch your
--   instances, if any. For more information, see <a>Placement Groups</a>.
uasgPlacementGroup :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A standalone termination policy or a list of termination policies used
--   to select the instance to terminate. The policies are executed in the
--   order that they are listed.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Choosing a Termination Policy for Your
--   AutoScaling Group</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
uasgTerminationPolicies :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup [Text]

-- | The subnet identifier for the Amazon VPC connection, if applicable.
--   You can specify several subnets in a comma-separated list.
--   
--   When you specify <tt>VPCZoneIdentifier</tt> with
--   <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt>, ensure that the subnets' Availability
--   Zones match the values you specify for <tt>AvailabilityZones</tt> .
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Auto Scaling and Amazon VPC</a> in the
--   <i>Auto ScalingDeveloper Guide</i>.
uasgVPCZoneIdentifier :: Lens' UpdateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)
data UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse

-- | <a>UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse</a> constructor.
updateAutoScalingGroupResponse :: UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Eq UpdateAutoScalingGroup
instance Ord UpdateAutoScalingGroup
instance Read UpdateAutoScalingGroup
instance Show UpdateAutoScalingGroup
instance Eq UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Ord UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Read UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Show UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Generic UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Datatype D1UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Constructor C1_0UpdateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateAutoScalingGroup
instance ToHeaders UpdateAutoScalingGroup
instance ToQuery UpdateAutoScalingGroup
instance ToPath UpdateAutoScalingGroup


-- | Terminates the specified instance and optionally adjusts the desired
--   group size.
--   
--   This call simply makes a termination request. The instances is not
--   terminated immediately.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup
data TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup

-- | <a>TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>tiiasgInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>tiiasgShouldDecrementDesiredCapacity</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
terminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup :: Text -> Bool -> TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup

-- | The ID of the EC2 instance.
tiiasgInstanceId :: Lens' TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup Text

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, terminating this instance also decrements the size
--   of the Auto Scaling group.
tiiasgShouldDecrementDesiredCapacity :: Lens' TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup Bool
data TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse

-- | <a>TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>tiiasgrActivity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Activity</a></li>
--   </ul>
terminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse :: TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse

-- | A scaling activity.
tiiasgrActivity :: Lens' TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse (Maybe Activity)
instance Eq TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup
instance Ord TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup
instance Read TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup
instance Show TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup
instance Eq TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Read TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Show TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance FromXML TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance AWSRequest TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup
instance ToHeaders TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup
instance ToQuery TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup
instance ToPath TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup


-- | Suspends the specified Auto Scaling processes for the specified Auto
--   Scaling group. To suspend specific processes, use the
--   <tt>ScalingProcesses</tt> parameter. To suspend all processes, omit
--   the <tt>ScalingProcesses</tt> parameter.
--   
--   Note that if you suspend either the <tt>Launch</tt> or
--   <tt>Terminate</tt> process types, it can prevent other process types
--   from functioning properly.
--   
--   To resume processes that have been suspended, use
--   <tt>ResumeProcesses</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Suspend and Resume Auto Scaling
--   Processes</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_SuspendProcesses.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.SuspendProcesses
data SuspendProcesses

-- | <a>SuspendProcesses</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>spAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>spScalingProcesses</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
suspendProcesses :: Text -> SuspendProcesses

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Auto Scaling group.
spAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' SuspendProcesses Text

-- | One or more of the following processes:
--   
--   Launch Terminate HealthCheck ReplaceUnhealthy AZRebalance
--   AlarmNotification ScheduledActions AddToLoadBalancer
spScalingProcesses :: Lens' SuspendProcesses [Text]
data SuspendProcessesResponse

-- | <a>SuspendProcessesResponse</a> constructor.
suspendProcessesResponse :: SuspendProcessesResponse
instance Eq SuspendProcesses
instance Ord SuspendProcesses
instance Read SuspendProcesses
instance Show SuspendProcesses
instance Eq SuspendProcessesResponse
instance Ord SuspendProcessesResponse
instance Read SuspendProcessesResponse
instance Show SuspendProcessesResponse
instance Generic SuspendProcessesResponse
instance Datatype D1SuspendProcessesResponse
instance Constructor C1_0SuspendProcessesResponse
instance AWSRequest SuspendProcesses
instance ToHeaders SuspendProcesses
instance ToQuery SuspendProcesses
instance ToPath SuspendProcesses


-- | Sets the health status of the specified instance.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Health Checks</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling
--   Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_SetInstanceHealth.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.SetInstanceHealth
data SetInstanceHealth

-- | <a>SetInstanceHealth</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sihHealthStatus</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sihInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sihShouldRespectGracePeriod</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
setInstanceHealth :: Text -> Text -> SetInstanceHealth

-- | The health status of the instance. Set to <tt>Healthy</tt> if you want
--   the instance to remain in service. Set to <tt>Unhealthy</tt> if you
--   want the instance to be out of service. Auto Scaling will terminate
--   and replace the unhealthy instance.
sihHealthStatus :: Lens' SetInstanceHealth Text

-- | The ID of the EC2 instance.
sihInstanceId :: Lens' SetInstanceHealth Text

-- | If the Auto Scaling group of the specified instance has a
--   <tt>HealthCheckGracePeriod</tt> specified for the group, by default,
--   this call will respect the grace period. Set this to <a>False</a>, if
--   you do not want the call to respect the grace period associated with
--   the group.
--   
--   For more information, see the <tt>HealthCheckGracePeriod</tt>
--   parameter description for <tt>CreateAutoScalingGroup</tt>.
sihShouldRespectGracePeriod :: Lens' SetInstanceHealth (Maybe Bool)
data SetInstanceHealthResponse

-- | <a>SetInstanceHealthResponse</a> constructor.
setInstanceHealthResponse :: SetInstanceHealthResponse
instance Eq SetInstanceHealth
instance Ord SetInstanceHealth
instance Read SetInstanceHealth
instance Show SetInstanceHealth

instance Read SetInstanceHealthResponse
instance Show SetInstanceHealthResponse

instance Datatype D1SetInstanceHealthResponse
instance Constructor C1_0SetInstanceHealthResponse
instance AWSRequest SetInstanceHealth
instance ToHeaders SetInstanceHealth
instance ToQuery SetInstanceHealth
instance ToPath SetInstanceHealth


-- | Sets the size of the specified <a>AutoScalingGroup</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_SetDesiredCapacity.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.SetDesiredCapacity
data SetDesiredCapacity

-- | <a>SetDesiredCapacity</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sdcAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>sdcDesiredCapacity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>sdcHonorCooldown</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
setDesiredCapacity :: Text -> Int -> SetDesiredCapacity

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group.
sdcAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' SetDesiredCapacity Text

-- | The number of EC2 instances that should be running in the Auto Scaling
--   group.
sdcDesiredCapacity :: Lens' SetDesiredCapacity Int

-- | By default, <a>SetDesiredCapacity</a> overrides any cooldown period
--   associated with the Auto Scaling group. Specify <a>True</a> to make
--   Auto Scaling to wait for the cool-down period associated with the Auto
--   Scaling group to complete before initiating a scaling activity to set
--   your Auto Scaling group to its new capacity.
sdcHonorCooldown :: Lens' SetDesiredCapacity (Maybe Bool)

--   </ul>
resumeProcesses :: Text -> ResumeProcesses

--

-- | Records a heartbeat for the lifecycle action associated with a
--   specific token. This extends the timeout by the length of time defined
--   by the <tt>HeartbeatTimeout</tt> parameter of
--   <tt>PutLifecycleHook</tt>.
--   
--   This operation is a part of the basic sequence for adding a lifecycle
--   hook to an Auto Scaling group:
--   
--   Create a notification target. A target can be either an Amazon SQS
--   queue or an Amazon SNS topic. Create an IAM role. This role allows
--   Auto Scaling to publish lifecycle notifications to the designated SQS
--   queue or SNS topic. Create the lifecycle hook. You can create a hook
--   that acts when instances launch or when instances terminate. If
--   necessary, record the lifecycle action heartbeat to keep the instance
--   in a pending state. Complete the lifecycle action. For more
--   information, see <a>Auto Scaling Pending State</a> and <a>Auto Scaling
--   Terminating State</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat
data RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat

-- | <a>RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rlahAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rlahLifecycleActionToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rlahLifecycleHookName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
recordLifecycleActionHeartbeat :: Text -> Text -> Text -> RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group for the hook.
rlahAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat Text

-- | A token that uniquely identifies a specific lifecycle action
--   associated with an instance. Auto Scaling sends this token to the
--   notification target you specified when you created the lifecycle hook.
rlahLifecycleActionToken :: Lens' RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat Text

-- | The name of the lifecycle hook.
rlahLifecycleHookName :: Lens' RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat Text
data RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse

-- | <a>RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse</a> constructor.
recordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse :: RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse
instance Eq RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat
instance Ord RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat
instance Read RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat
instance Show RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat
instance Eq RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse
instance Ord RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse
instance Read RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse
instance Show RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse
instance Generic RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse
instance Datatype D1RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse
instance Constructor C1_0RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeatResponse
instance AWSRequest RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat
instance ToHeaders RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat
instance ToQuery RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat
instance ToPath RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat


-- | Creates or updates a scheduled scaling action for an Auto Scaling
--   group. When updating a scheduled scaling action, if you leave a
--   parameter unspecified, the corresponding value remains unchanged in
--   the affected Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Scheduled Scaling</a> in the <i>Auto
--   Scaling DeveloperGuide</i>.
--   
--   Auto Scaling supports the date and time expressed in
--   <a>YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ</a> format in UTC/GMT only.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction
data PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction

-- | <a>PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>psugaAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>psugaDesiredCapacity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>psugaEndTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>psugaMaxSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>psugaMinSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>psugaRecurrence</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>psugaScheduledActionName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>psugaStartTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>psugaTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   </ul>
putScheduledUpdateGroupAction :: Text -> Text -> PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Auto Scaling group.
psugaAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction Text

-- | The number of Amazon EC2 instances that should be running in the
--   group.
psugaDesiredCapacity :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Int)

-- | The time for this action to end.
psugaEndTime :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The maximum size for the Auto Scaling group.
psugaMaxSize :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Int)

-- | The minimum size for the new Auto Scaling group.
psugaMinSize :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Int)

-- | The time when recurring future actions will start. Start time is
--   specified by the user following the Unix cron syntax format. For
--   information about cron syntax, go to <a>Wikipedia, The Free
--   Encyclopedia</a>.
--   
--   When <tt>StartTime</tt> and <tt>EndTime</tt> are specified with
--   <tt>Recurrence</tt>, they form the boundaries of when the recurring
--   action will start and stop.
psugaRecurrence :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of this scaling action.
psugaScheduledActionName :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction Text

-- | The time for this action to start, as in '--start-time
--   2010-06-01T00:00:00Z'.
--   
--   If you try to schedule your action in the past, Auto Scaling returns
--   an error message.
--   
--   When <tt>StartTime</tt> and <tt>EndTime</tt> are specified with
--   <tt>Recurrence</tt>, they form the boundaries of when the recurring
--   action will start and stop.
psugaStartTime :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | <a>Time</a> is deprecated.
--   
--   The time for this action to start. <a>Time</a> is an alias for
--   <tt>StartTime</tt> and can be specified instead of <tt>StartTime</tt>,
--   or vice versa. If both <a>Time</a> and <tt>StartTime</tt> are
--   specified, their values should be identical. Otherwise,
--   <a>PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction</a> will return an error.
psugaTime :: Lens' PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction (Maybe UTCTime)
data PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse

-- | <a>PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse</a> constructor.
putScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse :: PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse
instance Eq PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction
instance Ord PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction
instance Read PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction
instance Show PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction
instance Eq PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse
instance Ord PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse
instance Read PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse
instance Show PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse
instance Generic PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse
instance Datatype D1PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse
instance Constructor C1_0PutScheduledUpdateGroupActionResponse
instance AWSRequest PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction
instance ToHeaders PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction
instance ToQuery PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction
instance ToPath PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction


-- | Creates or updates a policy for an Auto Scaling group. To update an
--   existing policy, use the existing policy name and set the parameters
--   you want to change. Any existing parameter not changed in an update to
--   an existing policy is not changed in this update request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_PutScalingPolicy.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.PutScalingPolicy
data PutScalingPolicy

-- | <a>PutScalingPolicy</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pspAdjustmentType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pspAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pspCooldown</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>pspMinAdjustmentStep</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>pspPolicyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pspScalingAdjustment</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
putScalingPolicy :: Text -> Text -> Int -> Text -> PutScalingPolicy

-- | Specifies whether the <tt>ScalingAdjustment</tt> is an absolute number
--   or a percentage of the current capacity. Valid values are
--   <tt>ChangeInCapacity</tt>, <tt>ExactCapacity</tt>, and
--   <tt>PercentChangeInCapacity</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Dynamic Scaling</a> in the <i>Auto
--   Scaling Developer Guide</i> .
pspAdjustmentType :: Lens' PutScalingPolicy Text

-- | The name or ARN of the group.
pspAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' PutScalingPolicy Text

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and
--   before the next scaling activity can start.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Understanding Auto Scaling Cooldowns</a>
--   in the <i>AutoScaling Developer Guide</i>.
pspCooldown :: Lens' PutScalingPolicy (Maybe Int)

-- | Used with <a>AdjustmentType</a> with the value
--   <tt>PercentChangeInCapacity</tt>, the scaling policy changes the
--   <tt>DesiredCapacity</tt> of the Auto Scaling group by at least the
--   number of instances specified in the value.
--   
--   You will get a <tt>ValidationError</tt> if you use
--   <tt>MinAdjustmentStep</tt> on a policy with an <a>AdjustmentType</a>
--   other than <tt>PercentChangeInCapacity</tt>.
pspMinAdjustmentStep :: Lens' PutScalingPolicy (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the policy.
pspPolicyName :: Lens' PutScalingPolicy Text

-- | The number of instances by which to scale. <a>AdjustmentType</a>
--   determines the interpretation of this number (e.g., as an absolute
--   number or as a percentage of the existing Auto Scaling group size). A
--   positive increment adds to the current capacity and a negative value
--   removes from the current capacity.
pspScalingAdjustment :: Lens' PutScalingPolicy Int
data PutScalingPolicyResponse

-- | <a>PutScalingPolicyResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>psprPolicyARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
putScalingPolicyResponse :: PutScalingPolicyResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
psprPolicyARN :: Lens' PutScalingPolicyResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq PutScalingPolicy
instance Ord PutScalingPolicy
instance Read PutScalingPolicy
instance Show PutScalingPolicy
instance Eq PutScalingPolicyResponse
instance Ord PutScalingPolicyResponse
instance Read PutScalingPolicyResponse
instance Show PutScalingPolicyResponse
instance Monoid PutScalingPolicyResponse
instance FromXML PutScalingPolicyResponse
instance AWSRequest PutScalingPolicy
instance ToHeaders PutScalingPolicy
instance ToQuery PutScalingPolicy
instance ToPath PutScalingPolicy


-- | Configures an Auto Scaling group to send notifications when specified
--   events take place. Subscribers to this topic can have messages for
--   events delivered to an endpoint such as a web server or email address.
--   
--   For more information see <a>Getting Notifications When Your Auto
--   Scaling GroupChanges</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   This configuration overwrites an existing configuration.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_PutNotificationConfiguration.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.PutNotificationConfiguration
data PutNotificationConfiguration

-- | <a>PutNotificationConfiguration</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>pncAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>pncNotificationTypes</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>pncTopicARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
putNotificationConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> PutNotificationConfiguration

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group.
pncAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' PutNotificationConfiguration Text

-- | The type of event that will cause the notification to be sent. For
--   details about notification types supported by Auto Scaling, see
--   <tt>DescribeAutoScalingNotificationTypes</tt>.
pncNotificationTypes :: Lens' PutNotificationConfiguration [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Simple Notification
--   Service (SNS) topic.
pncTopicARN :: Lens' PutNotificationConfiguration Text
data PutNotificationConfigurationResponse

-- | <a>PutNotificationConfigurationResponse</a> constructor.
putNotificationConfigurationResponse :: PutNotificationConfigurationResponse

instance Ord PutNotificationConfiguration

instance Show PutNotificationConfiguration

instance Datatype D1PutNotificationConfigurationResponse
instance Constructor C1_0PutNotificationConfigurationResponse
instance AWSRequest PutNotificationConfiguration
instance ToHeaders PutNotificationConfiguration
instance ToQuery PutNotificationConfiguration
instance ToPath PutNotificationConfiguration


-- | Creates or updates a lifecycle hook for the specified Auto Scaling
--   Group.
--   
--   A lifecycle hook tells Auto Scaling that you want to perform an action
--   on an instance that is not actively in service; for example, either
--   when the instance launches or before the instance terminates.
--   
--   This operation is a part of the basic sequence for adding a lifecycle
--   hook to an Auto Scaling group:
--   
--   Create a notification target. A target can be either an Amazon SQS
--   queue or an Amazon SNS topic. Create an IAM role. This role allows
--   Auto Scaling to publish lifecycle notifications to the designated SQS
--   queue or SNS topic. Create the lifecycle hook. You can create a hook
--   that acts when instances launch or when instances terminate. If
--   necessary, record the lifecycle action heartbeat to keep the instance
--   in a pending state. Complete the lifecycle action. For more
--   information, see <a>Auto Scaling Pending State</a> and <a>Auto Scaling
--   Terminating State</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_PutLifecycleHook.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.PutLifecycleHook
data PutLifecycleHook

-- | <a>PutLifecycleHook</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>plhAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>plhDefaultResult</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>plhHeartbeatTimeout</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>plhLifecycleHookName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>plhLifecycleTransition</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>plhNotificationMetadata</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>plhNotificationTargetARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>plhRoleARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
putLifecycleHook :: Text -> Text -> PutLifecycleHook

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group to which you want to assign the
--   lifecycle hook.
plhAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' PutLifecycleHook Text

-- | Defines the action the Auto Scaling group should take when the
--   lifecycle hook timeout elapses or if an unexpected failure occurs. The
--   value for this parameter can be either <tt>CONTINUE</tt> or
--   <tt>ABANDON</tt>. The default value for this parameter is
--   <tt>ABANDON</tt>.
plhDefaultResult :: Lens' PutLifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | Defines the amount of time, in seconds, that can elapse before the
--   lifecycle hook times out. When the lifecycle hook times out, Auto
--   Scaling performs the action defined in the <tt>DefaultResult</tt>
--   parameter. You can prevent the lifecycle hook from timing out by
--   calling <tt>RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat</tt>. The default value for
--   this parameter is 3600 seconds (1 hour).
plhHeartbeatTimeout :: Lens' PutLifecycleHook (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the lifecycle hook.
plhLifecycleHookName :: Lens' PutLifecycleHook Text

-- | The Amazon EC2 instance state to which you want to attach the
--   lifecycle hook. See <tt>DescribeLifecycleHookTypes</tt> for a list of
--   available lifecycle hook types.
--   
--   This parameter is required for new lifecycle hooks, but optional when
--   updating existing hooks.
plhLifecycleTransition :: Lens' PutLifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains additional information that you want to include any time Auto
--   Scaling sends a message to the notification target.
plhNotificationMetadata :: Lens' PutLifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the notification target that Auto Scaling will use to
--   notify you when an instance is in the transition state for the
--   lifecycle hook. This ARN target can be either an SQS queue or an SNS
--   topic.
--   
--   This parameter is required for new lifecycle hooks, but optional when
--   updating existing hooks.
--   
--   The notification message sent to the target will include:
--   
--   LifecycleActionToken. The Lifecycle action token. AccountId. The user
--   account ID. AutoScalingGroupName. The name of the Auto Scaling group.
--   LifecycleHookName . The lifecycle hook name. EC2InstanceId. The EC2
--   instance ID. LifecycleTransition . The lifecycle transition.
--   NotificationMetadata. The notification metadata. This operation uses
--   the JSON format when sending notifications to an Amazon SQS queue, and
--   an email key/value pair format when sending notifications to an Amazon
--   SNS topic.
--   
--   When you call this operation, a test message is sent to the
--   notification target. This test message contains an additional
--   key/value pair: 'Event:autoscaling:TEST_NOTIFICATION'.
plhNotificationTargetARN :: Lens' PutLifecycleHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that allows the Auto Scaling group to publish
--   to the specified notification target.
--   
--   This parameter is required for new lifecycle hooks, but optional when
--   updating existing hooks.
plhRoleARN :: Lens' PutLifecycleHook (Maybe Text)
data PutLifecycleHookResponse

-- | <a>PutLifecycleHookResponse</a> constructor.
putLifecycleHookResponse :: PutLifecycleHookResponse
instance Eq PutLifecycleHook
instance Ord PutLifecycleHook
instance Read PutLifecycleHook
instance Show PutLifecycleHook
instance Eq PutLifecycleHookResponse
instance Ord PutLifecycleHookResponse
instance Read PutLifecycleHookResponse
instance Show PutLifecycleHookResponse
instance Generic PutLifecycleHookResponse
instance Datatype D1PutLifecycleHookResponse
instance Constructor C1_0PutLifecycleHookResponse
instance AWSRequest PutLifecycleHook
instance ToHeaders PutLifecycleHook
instance ToQuery PutLifecycleHook
instance ToPath PutLifecycleHook


-- | Moves the specified instances out of <a>Standby</a> mode.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Auto Scaling InService State</a> in the
--   <i>Auto ScalingDeveloper Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_ExitStandby.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.ExitStandby
data ExitStandby

-- | <a>ExitStandby</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>es1AutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>es1InstanceIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
exitStandby :: Text -> ExitStandby

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group.
es1AutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' ExitStandby Text

-- | One or more instance IDs. You must specify at least one instance ID.
es1InstanceIds :: Lens' ExitStandby [Text]
data ExitStandbyResponse

-- | <a>ExitStandbyResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>esrActivities</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Activity</a>]</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Executes the specified policy.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_ExecutePolicy.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.ExecutePolicy
data ExecutePolicy

-- | <a>ExecutePolicy</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>epAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>epHonorCooldown</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>epPolicyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
executePolicy :: Text -> ExecutePolicy

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Auto Scaling group.
epAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' ExecutePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <a>True</a> if you want Auto Scaling to wait for the cooldown
--   period associated with the Auto Scaling group to complete before
--   executing the policy.
--   
--   Set to <a>False</a> if you want Auto Scaling to circumvent the
--   cooldown period associated with the Auto Scaling group and execute the
--   policy before the cooldown period ends.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Understanding Auto Scaling Cooldowns</a>
--   in the <i>AutoScaling Developer Guide</i>.
epHonorCooldown :: Lens' ExecutePolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name or ARN of the policy.
epPolicyName :: Lens' ExecutePolicy Text
data ExecutePolicyResponse

-- | <a>ExecutePolicyResponse</a> constructor.
executePolicyResponse :: ExecutePolicyResponse
instance Eq ExecutePolicy
instance Ord ExecutePolicy
instance Read ExecutePolicy
instance Show ExecutePolicy
instance Eq ExecutePolicyResponse
instance Ord ExecutePolicyResponse
instance Read ExecutePolicyResponse
instance Show ExecutePolicyResponse
instance Generic ExecutePolicyResponse
instance Datatype D1ExecutePolicyResponse
instance Constructor C1_0ExecutePolicyResponse
instance AWSRequest ExecutePolicy
instance ToHeaders ExecutePolicy
instance ToQuery ExecutePolicy
instance ToPath ExecutePolicy


-- | Moves the specified instances into <a>Standby</a> mode.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Auto Scaling InService State</a> in the
--   <i>Auto ScalingDeveloper Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_EnterStandby.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.EnterStandby
data EnterStandby

-- | <a>EnterStandby</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>esAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>esInstanceIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>esShouldDecrementDesiredCapacity</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
enterStandby :: Text -> Bool -> EnterStandby

-- | The name of the Auto Scaling group.
esAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' EnterStandby Text

-- | One or more instances to move into <a>Standby</a> mode. You must
--   specify at least one instance ID.
esInstanceIds :: Lens' EnterStandby [Text]

-- | Specifies whether the instances moved to <a>Standby</a> mode count as
--   part of the Auto Scaling group's desired capacity. If set, the desired
--   capacity for the Auto Scaling group decrements by the number of
--   instances moved to <a>Standby</a> mode.
esShouldDecrementDesiredCapacity :: Lens' EnterStandby Bool
data EnterStandbyResponse

-- | <a>EnterStandbyResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>esr1Activities</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Activity</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
enterStandbyResponse :: EnterStandbyResponse

-- | The activities related to moving instances into <a>Standby</a> mode.
esr1Activities :: Lens' EnterStandbyResponse [Activity]
instance Eq EnterStandby
instance Ord EnterStandby
instance Read EnterStandby
instance Show EnterStandby
instance Eq EnterStandbyResponse
instance Read EnterStandbyResponse
instance Show EnterStandbyResponse
instance Monoid EnterStandbyResponse
instance Semigroup EnterStandbyResponse
instance FromXML EnterStandbyResponse
instance AWSRequest EnterStandby
instance ToHeaders EnterStandby
instance ToQuery EnterStandby
instance ToPath EnterStandby
instance IsList EnterStandbyResponse


-- | Enables monitoring of the specified metrics for the specified Auto
--   Scaling group.
--   
--   You can only enable metrics collection if <a>InstanceMonitoring</a> in
--   the launch configuration for the group is set to <a>True</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_EnableMetricsCollection.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.EnableMetricsCollection
data EnableMetricsCollection

-- | <a>EnableMetricsCollection</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>emcAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>emcGranularity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>emcMetrics</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
enableMetricsCollection :: Text -> Text -> EnableMetricsCollection

-- | The name or ARN of the Auto Scaling group.
emcAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' EnableMetricsCollection Text

-- | The granularity to associate with the metrics to collect. Currently,
--   the only valid value is "1Minute".
emcGranularity :: Lens' EnableMetricsCollection Text

-- | One or more of the following metrics:
--   
--   GroupMinSize
--   
--   GroupMaxSize
--   
--   GroupDesiredCapacity
--   
--   GroupInServiceInstances
--   
--   GroupPendingInstances
--   
--   GroupStandbyInstances
--   
--   GroupTerminatingInstances
--   
--   GroupTotalInstances
--   
--   If you omit this parameter, all metrics are enabled.
--   
--   The <tt>GroupStandbyInstances</tt> metric is not returned by default.
--   You must explicitly request it when calling
--   <a>EnableMetricsCollection</a>.
emcMetrics :: Lens' EnableMetricsCollection [Text]
data EnableMetricsCollectionResponse

-- | <a>EnableMetricsCollectionResponse</a> constructor.
enableMetricsCollectionResponse :: EnableMetricsCollectionResponse
instance Eq EnableMetricsCollection
instance Ord EnableMetricsCollection
instance Read EnableMetricsCollection
instance Show EnableMetricsCollection
instance Eq EnableMetricsCollectionResponse
instance Ord EnableMetricsCollectionResponse
instance Read EnableMetricsCollectionResponse
instance Show EnableMetricsCollectionResponse
instance Generic EnableMetricsCollectionResponse
instance Datatype D1EnableMetricsCollectionResponse
instance Constructor C1_0EnableMetricsCollectionResponse
instance AWSRequest EnableMetricsCollection
instance ToHeaders EnableMetricsCollection
instance ToQuery EnableMetricsCollection
instance ToPath EnableMetricsCollection

--   <li><a>dmcMetrics</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
disableMetricsCollection :: Text -> DisableMetricsCollection

-- | The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group.
dmcAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' DisableMetricsCollection Text

-- | One or more of the following metrics:
--   
--   GroupMinSize
--   
--   GroupMaxSize
--   
--   GroupDesiredCapacity
--   
--   GroupInServiceInstances
--   
--   GroupPendingInstances
--

--   Scaling Group</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
--

--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DetachInstances.html</a>

--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | One or more instance IDs.

-- | If <a>True</a>, the Auto Scaling group decrements the desired capacity

diShouldDecrementDesiredCapacity :: Lens' DetachInstances Bool

-- | Describes the specified tags.
--   
--   You can use filters to limit the results. For example, you can query
--   for the tags for a specific Auto Scaling group. You can specify
--   multiple values for a filter. A tag must match at least one of the
--   specified values for it to be included in the results.
--   
--   You can also specify multiple filters. The result includes information
--   for a particular tag only if it matches all the filters. If there's no
--   match, no special message is returned.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeTags.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DescribeTags
data DescribeTags

-- | <a>DescribeTags</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtFilters</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Filter</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dtMaxRecords</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtNextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeTags :: DescribeTags

-- | The value of the filter type used to identify the tags to be returned.
--   For example, you can filter so that tags are returned according to
--   Auto Scaling group, the key and value, or whether the new tag will be
--   applied to instances launched after the tag is created
--   (PropagateAtLaunch).
dtFilters :: Lens' DescribeTags [Filter]

-- | The maximum number of items to return with this call.
dtMaxRecords :: Lens' DescribeTags (Maybe Int)

-- | The token for the next set of items to return. (You received this
--   token from a previous call.)
dtNextToken :: Lens' DescribeTags (Maybe Text)
data DescribeTagsResponse

-- | <a>DescribeTagsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtrNextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtrTags</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>TagDescription</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeTagsResponse :: DescribeTagsResponse

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are
--   no additional items to return, the string is empty.
dtrNextToken :: Lens' DescribeTagsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The tags.
dtrTags :: Lens' DescribeTagsResponse [TagDescription]
instance Eq DescribeTags
instance Read DescribeTags
instance Show DescribeTags
instance Eq DescribeTagsResponse
instance Read DescribeTagsResponse
instance Show DescribeTagsResponse
instance AWSPager DescribeTags
instance FromXML DescribeTagsResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeTags
instance ToHeaders DescribeTags
instance ToQuery DescribeTags
instance ToPath DescribeTags


-- | Lists the actions scheduled for your Auto Scaling group that haven't
--   been executed. To list the actions that were already executed, use
--   <tt>DescribeScalingActivities</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeScheduledActions.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DescribeScheduledActions
data DescribeScheduledActions

-- | <a>DescribeScheduledActions</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dsa1AutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dsa1EndTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   <li><a>dsa1MaxRecords</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>dsa1NextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dsa1ScheduledActionNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dsa1StartTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>UTCTime</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeScheduledActions :: DescribeScheduledActions

-- | The name of the group.
dsa1AutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' DescribeScheduledActions (Maybe Text)

-- | The latest scheduled start time to return. If scheduled action names
--   are provided, this parameter is ignored.
dsa1EndTime :: Lens' DescribeScheduledActions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The maximum number of items to return with this call.
dsa1MaxRecords :: Lens' DescribeScheduledActions (Maybe Int)

-- | The token for the next set of items to return. (You received this
--   token from a previous call.)
dsa1NextToken :: Lens' DescribeScheduledActions (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes one or more scheduled actions. If you omit this list, the
--   call describes all scheduled actions. If you specify an unknown
--   scheduled action it is ignored with no error.
--   
--   You can describe up to a maximum of 50 instances with a single call.
--   If there are more items to return, the call returns a token. To get
--   the next set of items, repeat the call with the returned token in the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter.
dsa1ScheduledActionNames :: Lens' DescribeScheduledActions [Text]

-- | The earliest scheduled start time to return. If scheduled action names
--   are provided, this parameter is ignored.
dsa1StartTime :: Lens' DescribeScheduledActions (Maybe UTCTime)
data DescribeScheduledActionsResponse

-- | <a>DescribeScheduledActionsResponse</a> constructor.
--

--

--   [<a>ScheduledUpdateGroupAction</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeScheduledActionsResponse :: DescribeScheduledActionsResponse

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are
--   no additional items to return, the string is empty.
dsarNextToken :: Lens' DescribeScheduledActionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The scheduled actions.
dsarScheduledUpdateGroupActions :: Lens' DescribeScheduledActionsResponse [ScheduledUpdateGroupAction]
