-- | Describes one or more scaling activities for the specified Auto
--   Scaling group. If you omit the <tt>ActivityIds</tt>, the call returns
--   all activities from the past six weeks. Activities are sorted by the
--   start time. Activities still in progress appear first on the list.
--   
--   You can specify a maximum number of items to be returned with a single
--   call. If there are more items to return, the call returns a token. To
--   get the next set of items, repeat the call with the returned token in
--   the <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeScalingActivities.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DescribeScalingActivities
data DescribeScalingActivities

-- | <a>DescribeScalingActivities</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dsa2ActivityIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dsa2AutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dsa2MaxRecords</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>dsa2NextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeScalingActivities :: DescribeScalingActivities

-- | A list containing the activity IDs of the desired scaling activities.
--   If this list is omitted, all activities are described. If an
--   <tt>AutoScalingGroupName</tt> is provided, the results are limited to
--   that group. The list of requested activities cannot contain more than
--   50 items. If unknown activities are requested, they are ignored with
--   no error.
dsa2ActivityIds :: Lens' DescribeScalingActivities [Text]

-- | The name of the group.
dsa2AutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' DescribeScalingActivities (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of items to return with this call.
dsa2MaxRecords :: Lens' DescribeScalingActivities (Maybe Int)

-- | The token for the next set of items to return. (You received this
--   token from a previous call.)
dsa2NextToken :: Lens' DescribeScalingActivities (Maybe Text)
data DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dsar1Activities</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Activity</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dsar1NextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeScalingActivitiesResponse :: DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse

-- | The scaling activities.
dsar1Activities :: Lens' DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse [Activity]

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are
--   no additional items to return, the string is empty.
dsar1NextToken :: Lens' DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq DescribeScalingActivities
instance Ord DescribeScalingActivities
instance Read DescribeScalingActivities
instance Show DescribeScalingActivities
instance Eq DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse
instance Read DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse
instance Show DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse
instance AWSPager DescribeScalingActivities
instance FromXML DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeScalingActivities
instance ToHeaders DescribeScalingActivities
instance ToQuery DescribeScalingActivities
instance ToPath DescribeScalingActivities


-- | Describes the policies for the specified Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   You can specify a maximum number of items to be returned with a single
--   call. If there are more items to return, the call returns a token. To
--   get the next set of items, repeat the call with the returned token in
--   the <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribePolicies.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DescribePolicies
data DescribePolicies

-- | <a>DescribePolicies</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dp1AutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dp1MaxRecords</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>dp1NextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dp1PolicyNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describePolicies :: DescribePolicies

-- | The name of the group.
dp1AutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' DescribePolicies (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of items to be returned with each call.
dp1MaxRecords :: Lens' DescribePolicies (Maybe Int)

-- | The token for the next set of items to return. (You received this
--   token from a previous call.)
dp1NextToken :: Lens' DescribePolicies (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more policy names or policy ARNs to be described. If you omit
--   this list, all policy names are described. If an group name is
--   provided, the results are limited to that group. This list is limited
--   to 50 items. If you specify an unknown policy name, it is ignored with
--   no error.
dp1PolicyNames :: Lens' DescribePolicies [Text]
data DescribePoliciesResponse

-- | <a>DescribePoliciesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dprNextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dprScalingPolicies</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>ScalingPolicy</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describePoliciesResponse :: DescribePoliciesResponse

-- | The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are
--   no additional items to return, the string is empty.
dprNextToken :: Lens' DescribePoliciesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The scaling policies.
dprScalingPolicies :: Lens' DescribePoliciesResponse [ScalingPolicy]
instance Eq DescribePolicies
instance Ord DescribePolicies
instance Read DescribePolicies
instance Show DescribePolicies

instance Show DescribePoliciesResponse

-- | Returns a list of metrics and a corresponding list of granularities
--   for each metric.
--   
--   The <tt>GroupStandbyInstances</tt> metric is not returned by default.
--   You must explicitly request it when calling
--   <tt>EnableMetricsCollection</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeMetricCollectionTypes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DescribeMetricCollectionTypes
data DescribeMetricCollectionTypes

-- | <a>DescribeMetricCollectionTypes</a> constructor.
describeMetricCollectionTypes :: DescribeMetricCollectionTypes
data DescribeMetricCollectionTypesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeMetricCollectionTypesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dmctrGranularities</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>MetricGranularityType</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dmctrMetrics</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>MetricCollectionType</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeMetricCollectionTypesResponse :: DescribeMetricCollectionTypesResponse

-- | The granularities for the listed metrics.
dmctrGranularities :: Lens' DescribeMetricCollectionTypesResponse [MetricGranularityType]

-- | One or more of the following metrics:
--   
--   GroupMinSize
--   
--   GroupMaxSize
--   
--   GroupDesiredCapacity
--   
--   GroupInServiceInstances
--   
--   GroupPendingInstances
--   
--   GroupStandbyInstances
--   
--   GroupTerminatingInstances
--   
--   GroupTotalInstances
--   
--   The <tt>GroupStandbyInstances</tt> metric is not returned by default.
--   You must explicitly request it when calling
--   <tt>EnableMetricsCollection</tt>.
dmctrMetrics :: Lens' DescribeMetricCollectionTypesResponse [MetricCollectionType]

-- | Describes one or more Auto Scaling instances. If a list is not
--   provided, the call describes all instances.
--   
--   You can describe up to a maximum of 50 instances with a single call.
--   By default, a call returns up to 20 instances. If there are more items
--   to return, the call returns a token. To get the next set of items,
--   repeat the call with the returned token in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   parameter.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeAutoScalingInstances.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DescribeAutoScalingInstances

-- | <a>DescribeAutoScalingInstances</a> constructor.
--

--

--   <li><a>dasiNextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>

--   you specify an ID that does not exist, it is ignored with no error.

-- | Describes the current Auto Scaling resource limits for your AWS
--   account.
--   
--   For information about requesting an increase in these limits, see
--   <a>AWSService Limits</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeAccountLimits.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DescribeAccountLimits
data DescribeAccountLimits

-- | <a>DescribeAccountLimits</a> constructor.
describeAccountLimits :: DescribeAccountLimits
data DescribeAccountLimitsResponse

-- | <a>DescribeAccountLimitsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dalrMaxNumberOfAutoScalingGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>dalrMaxNumberOfLaunchConfigurations</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Maybe</a> <a>Int</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeAccountLimitsResponse :: DescribeAccountLimitsResponse

-- | The maximum number of groups allowed for your AWS account. The default
--   limit is 20 per region.
dalrMaxNumberOfAutoScalingGroups :: Lens' DescribeAccountLimitsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The maximum number of launch configurations allowed for your AWS
--   account. The default limit is 100 per region.
dalrMaxNumberOfLaunchConfigurations :: Lens' DescribeAccountLimitsResponse (Maybe Int)
instance Eq DescribeAccountLimits
instance Ord DescribeAccountLimits
instance Read DescribeAccountLimits
instance Show DescribeAccountLimits
instance Generic DescribeAccountLimits
instance Eq DescribeAccountLimitsResponse
instance Ord DescribeAccountLimitsResponse
instance Read DescribeAccountLimitsResponse
instance Show DescribeAccountLimitsResponse
instance Datatype D1DescribeAccountLimits
instance Constructor C1_0DescribeAccountLimits
instance FromXML DescribeAccountLimitsResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeAccountLimits
instance ToHeaders DescribeAccountLimits
instance ToQuery DescribeAccountLimits
instance ToPath DescribeAccountLimits


-- | Deletes the specified tags.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteTags.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DeleteTags
data DeleteTags

-- | <a>DeleteTags</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtTags</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Tag</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
deleteTags :: DeleteTags

-- | Each tag should be defined by its resource type, resource ID, key,
--   value, and a propagate flag. Valid values are: Resource type =
--   <i>auto-scaling-group</i>, Resource ID = <i>AutoScalingGroupName</i>,
--   key=<i>value</i>, value=<i>value</i>, propagate=<i>true</i> or
--   <i>false</i>.
dtTags :: Lens' DeleteTags [Tag]

-- | Deletes the specified Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   The group must have no instances and no scaling activities in
--   progress.
--   
--   To remove all instances before calling <a>DeleteAutoScalingGroup</a>,
--   you can call <tt>UpdateAutoScalingGroup</tt> to set the minimum and
--   maximum size of the AutoScalingGroup to zero.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteAutoScalingGroup.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.DeleteAutoScalingGroup
data DeleteAutoScalingGroup

-- | <a>DeleteAutoScalingGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dasgAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dasgForceDelete</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   </ul>
deleteAutoScalingGroup :: Text -> DeleteAutoScalingGroup

-- | The name of the group to delete.
dasgAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' DeleteAutoScalingGroup Text

-- | Specifies that the group will be deleted along with all instances
--   associated with the group, without waiting for all instances to be
--   terminated. This parameter also deletes any lifecycle actions
--   associated with the group.
dasgForceDelete :: Lens' DeleteAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Bool)
data DeleteAutoScalingGroupResponse

-- | <a>DeleteAutoScalingGroupResponse</a> constructor.
deleteAutoScalingGroupResponse :: DeleteAutoScalingGroupResponse

instance ToHeaders DeleteAutoScalingGroup
instance ToQuery DeleteAutoScalingGroup
instance ToPath DeleteAutoScalingGroup


-- | Creates or updates tags for the specified Auto Scaling group.
--   
--   A tag's definition is composed of a resource ID, resource type, key
--   and value, and the propagate flag. Value and the propagate flag are
--   optional parameters. See the Request Parameters for more information.
--   For more information, see <a>Add, Modify, or Remove Auto Scaling Group
--   Tags</a> in the <i>AutoScaling Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_CreateOrUpdateTags.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.CreateOrUpdateTags
data CreateOrUpdateTags

-- | <a>CreateOrUpdateTags</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>coutTags</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Tag</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
createOrUpdateTags :: CreateOrUpdateTags

-- | The tag to be created or updated. Each tag should be defined by its
--   resource type, resource ID, key, value, and a propagate flag. The
--   resource type and resource ID identify the type and name of resource
--   for which the tag is created. Currently, 'auto-scaling-group' is the
--   only supported resource type. The valid value for the resource ID is
--   <i>groupname</i>.
--   
--   The <tt>PropagateAtLaunch</tt> flag defines whether the new tag will
--   be applied to instances launched by the group. Valid values are
--   <tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt>. However, instances that are already
--   running will not get the new or updated tag. Likewise, when you modify
--   a tag, the updated version will be applied only to new instances
--   launched by the group after the change. Running instances that had the
--   previous version of the tag will continue to have the older tag.
--   
--   When you create a tag and a tag of the same name already exists, the
--   operation overwrites the previous tag definition, but you will not get
--   an error message.
coutTags :: Lens' CreateOrUpdateTags [Tag]
data CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse

-- | <a>CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse</a> constructor.
createOrUpdateTagsResponse :: CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse
instance Eq CreateOrUpdateTags
instance Read CreateOrUpdateTags
instance Show CreateOrUpdateTags
instance Monoid CreateOrUpdateTags
instance Semigroup CreateOrUpdateTags
instance Eq CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse
instance Ord CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse
instance Read CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse
instance Show CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse
instance Generic CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse
instance Datatype D1CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse
instance Constructor C1_0CreateOrUpdateTagsResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateOrUpdateTags
instance ToHeaders CreateOrUpdateTags
instance ToQuery CreateOrUpdateTags
instance ToPath CreateOrUpdateTags
instance IsList CreateOrUpdateTags


-- | Creates a launch configuration.
--   
--   If you exceed your maximum limit of launch configurations, which by
--   default is 100 per region, the call fails. For information about
--   viewing and updating these limits, see <tt>DescribeAccountLimits</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_CreateLaunchConfiguration.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.CreateLaunchConfiguration
data CreateLaunchConfiguration

-- | <a>CreateLaunchConfiguration</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>clcAssociatePublicIpAddress</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcBlockDeviceMappings</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clcClassicLinkVPCId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcClassicLinkVPCSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clcEbsOptimized</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcIamInstanceProfile</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcImageId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcInstanceMonitoring</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>InstanceMonitoring</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcInstanceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcKernelId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcKeyName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcLaunchConfigurationName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcPlacementTenancy</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcRamdiskId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcSecurityGroups</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>clcSpotPrice</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>clcUserData</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createLaunchConfiguration :: Text -> CreateLaunchConfiguration

-- | Used for groups that launch instances into a virtual private cloud
--   (VPC). Specifies whether to assign a public IP address to each
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Auto Scaling and Amazon VPC</a>
--   in the <i>Auto Scaling DeveloperGuide</i>.
--   
--   If you specify a value for this parameter, be sure to specify at least
--   one subnet using the <i>VPCZoneIdentifier</i> parameter when you
--   create your group.
--   
--   Default: If the instance is launched into a default subnet, the
--   default is <tt>true</tt>. If the instance is launched into a
--   nondefault subnet, the default is <tt>false</tt>. For more
--   information, see <a>Supported Platforms</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic
--   ComputeCloud User Guide</i>.
clcAssociatePublicIpAddress :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | One or more mappings that specify how block devices are exposed to the
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Block Device Mapping</a> in the
--   <i>AmazonElastic Compute Cloud User Guide</i>.
clcBlockDeviceMappings :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration [BlockDeviceMapping]

-- | The ID of a ClassicLink-enabled VPC to link your EC2-Classic instances
--   to. This parameter can only be used if you are launching EC2-Classic
--   instances. For more information, see <a>ClassicLink</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Elastic Compute CloudUser Guide</i>.
clcClassicLinkVPCId :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The IDs of one or more security groups for the VPC specified in
--   <tt>ClassicLinkVPCId</tt>. This parameter is required if
--   <tt>ClassicLinkVPCId</tt> is specified, and cannot be used otherwise.
--   For more information, see <a>ClassicLink</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   ElasticCompute Cloud User Guide</i>.
clcClassicLinkVPCSecurityGroups :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration [Text]

-- | Indicates whether the instance is optimized for Amazon EBS I/O. By
--   default, the instance is not optimized for EBS I/O. The optimization
--   provides dedicated throughput to Amazon EBS and an optimized
--   configuration stack to provide optimal I/O performance. This
--   optimization is not available with all instance types. Additional
--   usage charges apply. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS-Optimized
--   Instances</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide</i>.
clcEbsOptimized :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile
--   associated with the IAM role for the instance.
--   
--   Amazon EC2 instances launched with an IAM role will automatically have
--   AWS security credentials available. You can use IAM roles with Auto
--   Scaling to automatically enable applications running on your Amazon
--   EC2 instances to securely access other AWS resources. For more
--   information, see <a>Launch AutoScaling Instances with an IAM Role</a>
--   in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
clcIamInstanceProfile :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to use to launch your EC2
--   instances. For more information, see <a>Finding an AMI</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Elastic Compute CloudUser Guide</i>.
clcImageId :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the EC2 instance to use to create the launch configuration.
--   
--   The new launch configuration derives attributes from the instance,
--   with the exception of the block device mapping.
--   
--   To create a launch configuration with a block device mapping or
--   override any other instance attributes, specify them as part of the
--   same request.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Create a Launch Configuration Using an
--   EC2 Instance</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
clcInstanceId :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Enables detailed monitoring if it is disabled. Detailed monitoring is
--   enabled by default.
--   
--   When detailed monitoring is enabled, Amazon Cloudwatch generates
--   metrics every minute and your account is charged a fee. When you
--   disable detailed monitoring, by specifying <a>False</a>, Cloudwatch
--   generates metrics every 5 minutes. For more information, see
--   <a>Monitor Your Auto Scaling Instances</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling
--   Developer Guide</i>.
clcInstanceMonitoring :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe InstanceMonitoring)

-- | The instance type of the Amazon EC2 instance. For information about
--   available Amazon EC2 instance types, see <a>Available Instance
--   Types</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Cloud Compute User Guide.</i>
clcInstanceType :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the kernel associated with the Amazon EC2 AMI.
clcKernelId :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the key pair. For more information, see <a>Amazon EC2 Key
--   Pairs</a> in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide</i>.
clcKeyName :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the launch configuration. This name must be unique within
--   the scope of your AWS account.
clcLaunchConfigurationName :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration Text

-- | The tenancy of the instance. An instance with a tenancy of
--   <tt>dedicated</tt> runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be
--   launched in a VPC.
--   
--   You must set the value of this parameter to <tt>dedicated</tt> if want
--   to launch Dedicated Instances in a shared tenancy VPC (VPC with
--   instance placement tenancy attribute set to 'default').
--   
--   If you specify a value for this parameter, be sure to specify at least
--   one VPC subnet using the <i>VPCZoneIdentifier</i> parameter when you
--   create your group.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Auto Scaling and Amazon VPC</a> in the
--   <i>Auto ScalingDeveloper Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid values: 'default' | <tt>dedicated</tt>
clcPlacementTenancy :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the RAM disk associated with the Amazon EC2 AMI.
clcRamdiskId :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more security groups with which to associate the instances.
--   
--   If your instances are launched in EC2-Classic, you can either specify
--   security group names or the security group IDs. For more information
--   about security groups for EC2-Classic, see <a>Amazon EC2 Security
--   Groups</a> in the <i>AmazonElastic Compute Cloud User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If your instances are launched in a VPC, specify security group IDs.
--   For more information, see <a>Security Groups for Your VPC</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon VirtualPrivate Cloud User Guide</i>.
clcSecurityGroups :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration [Text]

-- | The maximum hourly price to be paid for any Spot Instance launched to
--   fulfill the request. Spot Instances are launched when the price you
--   specify exceeds the current Spot market price. For more information,
--   see <a>Launch SpotInstances in Your Auto Scaling Group</a> in the
--   <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
clcSpotPrice :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The user data to make available to the launched EC2 instances. For
--   more information, see <a>Instance Metadata and User Data</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon ElasticCompute Cloud User Guide</i>.
--   
--   At this time, launch configurations don't support compressed (zipped)
--   user data files.
clcUserData :: Lens' CreateLaunchConfiguration (Maybe Text)
data CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse

-- | <a>CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse</a> constructor.
createLaunchConfigurationResponse :: CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse
instance Eq CreateLaunchConfiguration
instance Read CreateLaunchConfiguration
instance Show CreateLaunchConfiguration
instance Eq CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse
instance Ord CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse
instance Read CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse
instance Show CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse
instance Generic CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse
instance Datatype D1CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse
instance Constructor C1_0CreateLaunchConfigurationResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateLaunchConfiguration
instance ToHeaders CreateLaunchConfiguration
instance ToQuery CreateLaunchConfiguration
instance ToPath CreateLaunchConfiguration


-- | Creates an Auto Scaling group with the specified name and attributes.
--   
--   If you exceed your maximum limit of Auto Scaling groups, which by
--   default is 20 per region, the call fails. For information about
--   viewing and updating these limits, see <tt>DescribeAccountLimits</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_CreateAutoScalingGroup.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.CreateAutoScalingGroup
data CreateAutoScalingGroup

-- | <a>CreateAutoScalingGroup</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>casgAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgAvailabilityZones</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>NonEmpty</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgDefaultCooldown</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgDesiredCapacity</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgHealthCheckGracePeriod</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgHealthCheckType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgLaunchConfigurationName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgLoadBalancerNames</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>casgMaxSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgMinSize</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Int</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgPlacementGroup</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>casgTags</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Tag</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>casgTerminationPolicies</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>casgVPCZoneIdentifier</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createAutoScalingGroup :: Text -> Int -> Int -> NonEmpty Text -> CreateAutoScalingGroup

-- | The name of the group. This name must be unique within the scope of
--   your AWS account.
casgAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup Text

-- | One or more Availability Zones for the group. This parameter is
--   optional if you specify subnets using the <tt>VPCZoneIdentifier</tt>
--   parameter.
casgAvailabilityZones :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes
--   before another scaling activity can start.
--   
--   If <tt>DefaultCooldown</tt> is not specified, the default value is
--   300. For more information, see <a>Understanding Auto Scaling
--   Cooldowns</a> in the <i>Auto ScalingDeveloper Guide</i>.
casgDefaultCooldown :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of EC2 instances that should be running in the group. This
--   value must be greater than or equal to the minimum size of the group
--   and less than or equal to the maximum size of the group.
casgDesiredCapacity :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, after an EC2 instance comes into
--   service that Auto Scaling starts checking its health. During this
--   time, any health check failures for the instance are ignored.
--   
--   This parameter is required if you are adding an <tt>ELB</tt> health
--   check. Frequently, new instances need to warm up, briefly, before they
--   can pass a health check. To provide ample warm-up time, set the health
--   check grace period of the group to match the expected startup period
--   of your application.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Add an Elastic Load Balancing Health
--   Check to YourAuto Scaling Group</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer
--   Guide</i>.
casgHealthCheckGracePeriod :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Int)

-- | The service to use for the health checks. The valid values are
--   <tt>EC2</tt> and <tt>ELB</tt>.
--   
--   By default, health checks use Amazon EC2 instance status checks to
--   determine the health of an instance. For more information, see
--   <a>Health Checks</a>.
casgHealthCheckType :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the EC2 instance used to create a launch configuration for
--   the group. Alternatively, use the <tt>LaunchConfigurationName</tt>
--   parameter to specify a launch configuration instead of an EC2
--   instance.
--   
--   When you specify an ID of an instance, Auto Scaling creates a new
--   launch configuration and associates it with the group. This launch
--   configuration derives its attributes from the specified instance, with
--   the exception of the block device mapping.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Create an Auto Scaling Group Using an EC2
--   InstanceID</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
casgInstanceId :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the launch configuration. Alternatively, use the
--   <tt>InstanceId</tt> parameter to specify an EC2 instance instead of a
--   launch configuration.
casgLaunchConfigurationName :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more load balancers.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Load Balance Your Auto Scaling Group</a>
--   in the <i>AutoScaling Developer Guide</i>.
casgLoadBalancerNames :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup [Text]

-- | The maximum size of the group.
casgMaxSize :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup Int

-- | The minimum size of the group.
casgMinSize :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup Int

-- | The name of the placement group into which you'll launch your
--   instances, if any. For more information, see <a>Placement Groups</a>.
casgPlacementGroup :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag to be created or updated. Each tag should be defined by its
--   resource type, resource ID, key, value, and a propagate flag. Valid
--   values: key=<i>value</i>, value=<i>value</i>, propagate=<i>true</i> or
--   <i>false</i>. Value and propagate are optional parameters.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Add, Modify, or Remove Auto Scaling Group
--   Tags</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
casgTags :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup [Tag]

-- | One or more termination policies used to select the instance to
--   terminate. These policies are executed in the order that they are
--   listed.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Choosing a Termination Policy for Your
--   AutoScaling Group</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
casgTerminationPolicies :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup [Text]

-- | A comma-separated list of subnet identifiers for your virtual private
--   cloud (VPC).
--   
--   If you specify subnets and Availability Zones with this call, ensure
--   that the subnets' Availability Zones match the Availability Zones
--   specified.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Auto Scaling and Amazon VPC</a> in the
--   <i>Auto ScalingDeveloper Guide</i>.
casgVPCZoneIdentifier :: Lens' CreateAutoScalingGroup (Maybe Text)
data CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse

-- | <a>CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse</a> constructor.
createAutoScalingGroupResponse :: CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Eq CreateAutoScalingGroup
instance Read CreateAutoScalingGroup
instance Show CreateAutoScalingGroup
instance Eq CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Ord CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Read CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Show CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Generic CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Datatype D1CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance Constructor C1_0CreateAutoScalingGroupResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateAutoScalingGroup
instance ToHeaders CreateAutoScalingGroup
instance ToQuery CreateAutoScalingGroup
instance ToPath CreateAutoScalingGroup


-- | Completes the lifecycle action for the associated token initiated
--   under the given lifecycle hook with the specified result.
--   
--   This operation is a part of the basic sequence for adding a lifecycle
--   hook to an Auto Scaling group:
--   
--   Create a notification target. A target can be either an Amazon SQS
--   queue or an Amazon SNS topic. Create an IAM role. This role allows
--   Auto Scaling to publish lifecycle notifications to the designated SQS
--   queue or SNS topic. Create the lifecycle hook. You can create a hook
--   that acts when instances launch or when instances terminate. If
--   necessary, record the lifecycle action heartbeat to keep the instance
--   in a pending state. Complete the lifecycle action. For more
--   information, see <a>Auto Scaling Pending State</a> and <a>Auto Scaling
--   Terminating State</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_CompleteLifecycleAction.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.CompleteLifecycleAction
data CompleteLifecycleAction

-- | <a>CompleteLifecycleAction</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>claAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>claLifecycleActionResult</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>claLifecycleActionToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>claLifecycleHookName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
completeLifecycleAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CompleteLifecycleAction

-- | The name of the group for the lifecycle hook.
claAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' CompleteLifecycleAction Text

-- | The action for the group to take. This parameter can be either
--   <tt>CONTINUE</tt> or <tt>ABANDON</tt>.
claLifecycleActionResult :: Lens' CompleteLifecycleAction Text

-- | A universally unique identifier (UUID) that identifies a specific
--   lifecycle action associated with an instance. Auto Scaling sends this
--   token to the notification target you specified when you created the
--   lifecycle hook.
claLifecycleActionToken :: Lens' CompleteLifecycleAction Text

-- | The name of the lifecycle hook.
claLifecycleHookName :: Lens' CompleteLifecycleAction Text
data CompleteLifecycleActionResponse

-- | <a>CompleteLifecycleActionResponse</a> constructor.
completeLifecycleActionResponse :: CompleteLifecycleActionResponse
instance Eq CompleteLifecycleAction
instance Ord CompleteLifecycleAction
instance Read CompleteLifecycleAction
instance Show CompleteLifecycleAction
instance Eq CompleteLifecycleActionResponse
instance Ord CompleteLifecycleActionResponse
instance Read CompleteLifecycleActionResponse
instance Show CompleteLifecycleActionResponse
instance Generic CompleteLifecycleActionResponse
instance Datatype D1CompleteLifecycleActionResponse
instance Constructor C1_0CompleteLifecycleActionResponse
instance AWSRequest CompleteLifecycleAction
instance ToHeaders CompleteLifecycleAction
instance ToQuery CompleteLifecycleAction
instance ToPath CompleteLifecycleAction


-- | Attaches one or more EC2 instances to the specified Auto Scaling
--   group.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Attach Amazon EC2 Instances to Your
--   Existing AutoScaling Group</a> in the <i>Auto Scaling Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/APIReference/API_AttachInstances.html</a>
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling.AttachInstances
data AttachInstances

-- | <a>AttachInstances</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>aiAutoScalingGroupName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>aiInstanceIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
attachInstances :: Text -> AttachInstances

-- | The name of the group.
aiAutoScalingGroupName :: Lens' AttachInstances Text

-- | One or more EC2 instance IDs. You must specify at least one ID.
aiInstanceIds :: Lens' AttachInstances [Text]
data AttachInstancesResponse

-- | <a>AttachInstancesResponse</a> constructor.
attachInstancesResponse :: AttachInstancesResponse
instance Eq AttachInstances
instance Ord AttachInstances
instance Read AttachInstances
instance Show AttachInstances
instance Eq AttachInstancesResponse
instance Ord AttachInstancesResponse
instance Read AttachInstancesResponse
instance Show AttachInstancesResponse
instance Generic AttachInstancesResponse
instance Datatype D1AttachInstancesResponse
instance Constructor C1_0AttachInstancesResponse
instance AWSRequest AttachInstances
instance ToHeaders AttachInstances
instance ToQuery AttachInstances
instance ToPath AttachInstances


-- | Auto Scaling allows you to scale your Amazon EC2 capacity up or down
--   automatically according to conditions you define. With Auto Scaling,
--   you can ensure that the number of Amazon EC2 instances you’re using
--   increases seamlessly during demand spikes to maintain performance, and
--   decreases automatically during demand lulls to minimize costs. Auto
--   Scaling is particularly well suited for applications that experience
--   hourly, daily, or weekly variability in usage. Auto Scaling is enabled
--   by Amazon CloudWatch and available at no additional charge beyond
--   Amazon CloudWatch fees.
module Network.AWS.AutoScaling
